intro: Exellodendron cordatum, commonly known as the heartleaf exellodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
